newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal's Sonae posts first half profit.
newsitem.headline: Portugal's Sonae posts first half profit.

text.p: Portugal's biggest industrial group Sonae Investimentos on Monday reported a consolidated net profit of 3.3 billion escudos ($21 million), at the upper end of analysts' expectations.

The profit compared with earnings of 6.3 billion escudos ($40.7 million) in the first half of 1995, swelled by a 3.9 billion escudo ($25 million) extraordinary profit from the sale of Sonae's stake in Banco Portugues do Atlantico, bought by Banco Comercial Portugues in March 1995.
Analysts had forecast 1996 first half earnings of between 2.0 billion ($13 million) and 3.5 billion escudos ($23 million).

Sonae Investimentos, whose interests range from retailing to real estate and wood products, forecast that full-year 1996 consolidated profits after minorities would stand at 13.9 billion escudos ($90 million), up from 12.9 billion ($83 million) in 1995.
It forecast 1996 consolidated sales of 460 billion escudos ($3.0 billion), up from 357 billion escudos ($2.3 billion) in 1995.
Sonae Investimentos's wood products group Sonae Industria posted a 225 million escudos profit ($1.5 million) in the first half, up from 169 million escudos ($1 million) in the same year-ago period.
Sonae Industria forecast a full-year 1996 profit of 0.400 billion escudos ($2.6 million), compared with 1.1 billion ($7 million) in the first half of 1995.

Another Sonae subsidiary, hypermarkets group Continente, posted consolidated net profits after minorities of 2.5 billion escudos ($16 million) in the first six months this year, up from 2.4 billion in the same year-ago period. $1=154.5 esc
